model.dek: Five days of pasta intel you can really sink your teeth into (because it's *al dente*).
model.body:
When we first talked about dedicating a week at Epicurious to pasta (a Pasta Week, if you will), it seemed like a no-brainer. Of *course* we should do a series of stories celebrating pasta. After all, there's no other food we turn to as instinctively and automatically as those Italian noodles. Too tired to cook something fancy? Make some pasta. Need something to eat while watching *The Voice*? Make some pasta. Nothing in the fridge? Two words: [pantry pasta](http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/pasta-with-15-minute-garlic-oil-and-anchovy-sauce-56390061). 

But the more we thought about the stuff, the more we realized how deep our pasta habits really run. Sometimes we turn into pasta zombies, mindlessly making the same old sauce week after week. We had a hunch that even when it comes to something as easy as weeknight pasta, there's a lot to learn. 

And learn we did. We learned how to make an [amazingly delicious meat sauce](http://www.epicurious.com/expert-advice/fast-easy-pasta-sauces-weeknights-article)—that tastes like it took all day to simmer—in just 15 minutes. We learned how [one simple ingredient](http://www.epicurious.com/expert-advice/top-your-pasta-with-breadcrumbs-article) can transform almost any plate of pasta. And we learned how to make a homemade pasta [without ever messing with dough](http://www.epicurious.com/recipes-menus/how-to-make-simple-two-ingredient-fresh-pasta-article).

And that's just the beginning. We're going to share pasta intel every day this week, and we hope you'll do the same. Tag shots of your pasta dinners with #weeknightpasta on Instagram and Twitter, and tell us how you like your pasta. Odds are, we'll like it, too. It's pasta, after all.
model.seoDescription: An introduction to Epicurious Pasta Week.
